titles: [The Manifesto of near 150 Knights and eminent merchants and citizens of London against the Jews now in England] [being a brief account of the Jews case (which is now become national) in relation to the customs, &c. / humbly presented to the King and Parliament by Samuel Hayne, Gent., sometime surveyor for the customs, and for the Act of Navigation in the counties of Devon and Cornwal]
notes: Continuation of Wing M428, found on reel 1487:9.
Consists of addresses to the King regarding taxes on aliens.
Imperfect: Cropped with loss of print.
Reproduction of original in Chetham's Library.
keywords: Great Britain --  History --  William and Mary, 1689-1702.
